alert.note: Alert for Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 2:38PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Flagler, St. Johns, Putnam and Clay Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kingsley to near Lake George. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. These storms will encounter the river and sea breezes with further intensification expected in storms expected. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Coast, Saint Augustine, Palatka, Orange Park, Green Cove Springs, Flagler Beach, Bunnell, Crescent City, Interlachen and Keystone Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. For boaters on or near the St Johns River or Intracoastal waterway, move to a safe shelter now! Do not be caught on or near the water. Gusty winds and choppy waves are likely. Make sure all on board are wearing life jackets.
